I'm delighted to hear you're interested in intriguing stories! Given your preference for historical settings, "The Egyptian" (1954) might be a captivating choice for you. It tells the story of an orphan who rises to become a genial physician at the Pharaoh's court, witnessing palace intrigues and learning dangerous royal secrets. Starring Peter Ustinov, Gene Tierney, and Jean Simmons, this film promises a thrilling journey through ancient Egypt.

If you're open to exploring a more mystical historical tale, "The Picture of Dorian Gray" (1891) could also be intriguing. This classic novel, adapted into films multiple times, tells the story of a man whose portrait ages instead of him, reflecting his moral decay. The film features a compelling exploration of sin and beauty.
